Company: New York State Electric & Gas Corp
Description: The New York State Public Service Commission announced a $200,000 settlement with New York State Electric & Gas Corp. after the utility failed to prevent a tree from encroaching a transmission line.

Company: New York State Electric & Gas Corp
Description: The New York State Public Service Commission announced that New York State Electric & Gas Corporation would pay $2 million in a settlement due to the company's failure to comply with rules requiring it to obtain Commission approval prior to expanding its service territory.

The New York State Public Service Commission adopted the terms of a joint proposal with Rochester Gas and Electric Corporation that would settle the company's liability for alleged violations stemming from a failure to adequately prepare for winter and spring storms in 2018.

Company: New York State Electric & Gas Corp
Description: The New York State Public Service Commission adopted the terms of a joint proposal with New York State Electric & Gas Corporation that would settle the company's liability for alleged violations stemming from a failure to adequately prepare for winter and spring storms in 2018.

The New York State Public Service Commission adopted a settlement that resolved penalty amounts for alleged violations against Rochester Gas & Electric Corp. for failing to comply with the terms and conditions of the Commission's utility pole attachment rules. The Commission accepted a negotiated settlement of $5 million against RG&E, with $2.5 million suspended pending compliance with remediation metrics.
The Maine Public Utilities Commission unanimously approved a settlement with Central Maine Power that included a $4 million penalty for inadequate service quality.
Improper disconnection notices
The company failed to document investigations and follow investigation protocol
Failure to take corrective action for previous gas pipeline safety violations.

Failing to comply with standards of acceptable performance in emergency preparation or restoration of service in an emergency and with orders of the Authority, and for violations of accident reporting requirements.
